bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from Frances B. Seth to Philip Showalter Hench, January 1, 1948

div1.p: Seth thanks Hench for the photographs and hopes to hear his speech in Washington in the spring.

div1.head: Letter from Frances B. Seth to Philip Showalter Hench, January 1, 1948

opener.dateline:
JAN 1, 1948 WINDSOR MILL ROAD
AT GWYNN'S FALLS BRIDGE

div1.p:
I AM SO GLAD TO HAVE THE
PICTURES OF FINLAY PARK IN HAVANA AND WAN
WANT TO THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR SEND-
ING THEM I SHALL ENJOY SHOWING THEM TO
MRS. GAWNE WHEN SHE RETURNS FROM HER
CHRISTMAS HOLIDAY WITH HER DAUGHTER'S
FAMILY IN OHIO.

I AM VERY INTERESTED IN YOUR PLANS
FOR THE MEETING IN WASHINGTON IN THE
SPRING. IT WOULD BE A GREAT PLEASURE
AND PRIVILEGE TO HEAR YOUR ADDRESS BUT
IN ANY CASE, I SHALL HOPE YOU AND MRS.
HENCH CAN FIND THE TIME TO COME TO WINDSOR
DURING YOUR STAY IN THE EAST.
WITH BEST WISHES FOR THE NEW YEAR
